etymology.description: 發(發) (fā, "issue; emit") and 票(票) (piào, "ticket; note") combine to form 發票(發票), referring to an "invoice".
etymology.interpretation: The word 發票(發票) (fāpiào, "invoice") makes sense as it combines 發(發) (fā, "issue") with 票(票) (piào, "ticket") to signify a document that records and issues the details of a transaction, much like a ticket or note.

examples.chinese: 请给我开一张发票(請給我開一張發票)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ kāi yī zhāng fāpiào.

examples.chinese: 商店给我提供发票(商店給我提供發票)，以便报销(以便報銷)。
examples.pinyin: Shāngdiàn gěi wǒ tígōng fāpiào, yǐbiàn bàoxiāo.
examples.english: The store provided me with an invoice for reimbursement.

examples.chinese: 他认真保存发票(他認真保存發票)，以备日后核对(以備日後核對)。
examples.pinyin: Tā rènzhēn bǎocún fāpiào, yǐbèi rìhòu héduì.
examples.english: He kept the invoice carefully for future verification.
